author: timbeiko
content: TL;DR re: EIP-2935 is that on last week's call, <@!425279588009246720> mentioned there had been several similar proposals in the past and that there were more details to flesh out on it. There is no major opposition to it, but <@!211091239112671234> and others would like to see someone try and move the conversations forward before we begin implementation. On the last ACD call, it seemed like Nethermind was interested in having this EIP, so we were wondering if you had researched it more or started an implementation?

author: s1na
content: i'm weighing eip-2935 against the approach that flyclient proposes, and if i could convince myself that the flyclient approach has enough benefits for it to be worth the additional complexity, I'd be interested in championing it

author: Deleted User
content: As I suggested before, the deep-dive technical break-out discussions need to be as asynchronous as possible. Because otherwise, instead of attending 1 call every 2 weeks, everyone has to attend 5 calls, things will get more frustrating. Leading asynchronous discussion requires different kind of facilitation skills from what most people are used to. To be effective facilitator, one needs to understand the discussion and summarise it regularly to present "the current state of things"

author: Deleted User
content: Another thing I see on Discord is an "instinct" to "fork" the communication whenever there are more than 1 topic is getting discussed. This is not sustainable and leads to too many channels to monitor

author: timbeiko
content:
> To be effective facilitator, one needs to understand the discussion and summarise it regularly to present "the current state of things"
I think this would be a very valuable thing for champions of EIPs to do. Kind of a weekly (or more frequently if many updates) summary and set of open questions.
